'''Julie Walters''', [[Order of the British Empire|CBE]] (born February 22, 1950) is an<!--awards and nominations don't belong here--> [[England|English]] actress and [[novelist]]. She came to international prominence in 1983 for ''[[Educating Rita (film)|Educating Rita]]'', performing in the title role opposite [[Michael Caine]]. It was a role she had created on the [[West End theatre|West End]] stage and it won her BAFTA and [[Golden Globe Award|Golden Globe]] awards for Best Actress. She is, perhaps, best known internationally for her on-screen [[characterisation]] of [[Molly Weasley]], the matriarch of the [[Weasley family]], in the acclaimed [[Harry Potter (film series)|Harry Potter]] motion picture octalogy, which includes the soon-to-be-released [[Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows (film)|Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part II]]. In 2006, she came fourth in [[ITV]]'s poll of the public's 50 Greatest Stars in the UK. She is known for her line "Not my daughter you..." in the Harry Potter series~.
+
'''Julie Walters''', [[Order of the British Empire|CBE]] (born February 22, 1950) is an<!--awards and nominations don't belong here--> [[England|English]] actress and [[novelist]]. She came to international prominence in 1983 for ''[[Educating Rita (film)|Educating Rita]]'', performing in the title role opposite [[Michael Caine]]. It was a role she had created on the [[West End theatre|West End]] stage and it won her BAFTA and [[Golden Globe Award|Golden Globe]] awards for Best Actress. She is, perhaps, best known internationally for her on-screen [[characterisation]] of [[Molly Weasley]], the matriarch of the [[Weasley family]], in the acclaimed [[Harry Potter (film series)|Harry Potter]] motion picture octalogy, which includes the soon-to-be-released [[Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows (film)|Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part II]]. In 2006, she came fourth in [[ITV]]'s poll of the public's 50 Greatest Stars in the UK.
